answers.answer: Oh, I'm so sorry you're going through all this.  I am going through the same thing, except that God blessed me with my now 4 year old boy.  I have been dealing with PCOS for a long time too (not as long as you).  Lately I have been letting things be without even trying to alleviate them because I'm dealing with other tough issues, but I'm about to start worrying about myself a little more. The very first time I knew something was wrong when I hadn't had a period in three years.  I gained a lot of weight and do you know what helped?  A low carb diet (usually no carbs or just a bowl of Corn Flakes in the morning and no carbs for the rest of the day) and I lost a lot of weight and started ovulating again pretty fast.  I had my period back for a while and that's when I conceived my son!  I'm very glad that I did of course.  After I had him, I stopped getting my period again, but you know how it goes; life happens and you get busy with other things.  It's hard to always maintain a diet so that you can keep ovulating, but it's possible.  I'm going to start again this coming week because even though I don't eat much and have no junk food, I still gained weight and it affects me emotionally.  Try it out.  Start a low carb diet and hopefully it will work for  you too and you'll start ovulating soon. Good luck.  I know it's hard, but try to stay positive.  Stress only contributes to the problem and affects ovulation too.
